data: Inscription recording construction of a sphaeristrium by a father and son

Substantial marble slab, damaged on all sides, and broken in three reconnected fragments, and with the upper edge and upper front face chiselled (for re-use?) such that traces of large letters can be seen in several places but no more.
Text fills the face, with traces of a larger line above; surviving line 1 is larger than the lines below.
Elegant tall and somewhat narrow v-cut letters with serifs. O is large, broad, and somewhat irregular in shape. R has curved and extended foot, P is open. G has straight foot.
Found in contrada Gelofia in 1877, and now on display in the Palermo archaeological museum
Photo J.Prag, 2022-05-23, courtesy Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.
Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
Jonathan Prag added metadata and translation

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text checked against photograph; illegible line 1 requires fresh autopsy.

English translation

Jonathan Prag

[------] Cornelius Grammeu[--- ?]lipax, son of Publius, and Publius Cornelius Long[---], son of Publius, grandson of Publius, father and son, for the honour of having held the duumvirate, built the sphaeristerium.
